refnamediv.refpurpose: Displays the current size and usage of the cache

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The fs getcacheparms command displays the current size of the cache (which can be in memory or on disk), and the amount currently in use.

The reported statistics are from kernel memory, so the reported size can differ from the setting specified in the /usr/vice/etc/cacheinfo file on a machine using a disk cache, if the fs setcachesize command has been used to alter cache size.

listitem.para: Prints the online help for this command. All other valid options are ignored.

refsect1.title: Output
refsect1.programlisting: AFS using <amount> of the cache's available <size> 1K byte blocks.
refsect1.para: where <amount> is the number of kilobyte blocks currently used to cache data and status information, and <size> is the total current cache size.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: The following example shows the output on a machine with a 25000 kilobyte cache.
refsect1.programlisting: % fs getcacheparms AFS using 22876 of the cache's available 25000 1K byte blocks.
